title: I am looking for two Sci-Fi books: one is about Hitler (he emigrates to the US before WW2 and founds his party there); the other one presents the Roman Empire as if it had never fallen. Does anyone know their titles? - Quora

response.answer_text: The one about Hitler sounds a little like THE IRON DREAM, by Norman Spinrad. The title is the name of a novel Hitler writes after moving to the U.S. and comprises most of the text of the book. It’s framed by an account of Hitler’s career as a minor science fiction writer with crazy ideas. I don’t recall that he actually founds a Nazi party in America; he just writes a fantasy of how he wants the world to be. So that could be the book you’re thinking of, although the correspondence to your question isn’t exact.

The Roman one could be Roma Eterna. Or one of these suggestions: Fiction set in ancient Rome - WikipediaAre there any books out there that involve a world where the Roman Empire never fell?Is there any fiction based on the premise that the Roman Empire never ended?The Nazi one is probably The Iron Dream.
